alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 11:32PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow with additional accumulations of up to 1 inch, with blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph tonight. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...In Illinois, Hancock and McDonough Counties. In Missouri, Scotland and Clark Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, especially tonight and Saturday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, and lead to isolated power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tonight, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
